Class LevelViewLevelTwo

java.lang.Object
Levels.LevelView
Levels.LevelViewLevelTwo
public class LevelViewLevelTwo extends LevelView
Represents the view layer for Level Two, extending the base LevelView. Adds specific UI elements for Level Two, such as the shield image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final javafx.scene.Group
    root
    The root container of the scene where all UI elements are added.
    private static final int
    SHIELD_X_POSITION
    X-coordinate for the shield image in the scene.
    private static final int
    SHIELD_Y_POSITION
    Y-coordinate for the shield image in the scene.
    private final ShieldImage
    shieldImage
    The shield image displayed in Level Two.

    Constructs a LevelViewLevelTwo instance with the specified root and number of hearts to display.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    addImagesToRoot()
    Adds the shield image to the root container, ensuring it is displayed in the scene.
    void
    hideShield()
    Hides the shield in the scene, making it invisible to the player.
    void
    showShield()
    Displays the shield in the scene, making it visible to the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelViewLevelTwo

      public LevelViewLevelTwo(javafx.scene.Group root, int heartsToDisplay)
      Constructs a LevelViewLevelTwo instance with the specified root and number of hearts to display. Initializes the shield image and adds it to the root.
      Parameters:
      root - the root container of the scene where the UI elements will be added.
      heartsToDisplay - the initial number of hearts to display.

  • Method Details

    • addImagesToRoot

      private void addImagesToRoot()
      Adds the shield image to the root container, ensuring it is displayed in the scene.

    • showShield

      public void showShield()
      Displays the shield in the scene, making it visible to the player.

    • hideShield

      public void hideShield()
      Hides the shield in the scene, making it invisible to the player.
